results.title: Shakespeare in love
results.creator_credit: John Madden, Harvey Weinstein, Donna Gigliotti, David Parfitt and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: From an original screenplay by Tom Stoppard and Marc Norman, “Shakespeare in Love” takes real historical figures and creates a fictional drama worthy of the twists and turns of one of the Bard’s own plays. William Shakespeare (Joseph Fiennes) is a struggling young playwright suddenly cursed with writer’s block. He lies to Phillip Henslowe the owner of the Rose Theatre, that his play “Romeo and Ethel, the Pirates Daughter” is ready. When the play is cast, William falls in love with the Lady Viola (Gwyneth Paltrow) who’s pretending to be a boy so she can be in the play. This love affair re-ignites Shakespeare’s passion to write and as the play unfolds during rehearsals it becomes “Romeo and Juliet” and Shakespeare emerges as the great playwright that we now take for granted. “Shakespeare in Love” is a joyous comedy romance which celebrates the passion of words. It’s great fun for Shakespeare enthusiasts to catch references to Shakespeare’s plays and allusions to Elizabethan drama. A great cast obviously has fun, with Judi Dench powerfully regal as Elizabeth I, Rubert Everett as Shakespeare’s great rival Kit Marlowe and Ben Affleck as the egotistical but talented Elizabethan actor Ned Alleyn. (Awards: Winner of 7 Academy Awards including 1998 Academy Award for Best Picture) This video includes a 24 minute documentary “Shakespeare in love and on film” with interviews with John Madden, Joseph Fiennes, Gwyneth Paltrow and Ben Affleck.

results.title: Shanghai triad
results.creator_credit: Zhang Yimou, Jean-Louis Piel, Wu Yigong and Shanghai Film Studio
results.brief_description: Set in the 1930s, this film centres on the coming of age of Shuisheng, a country boy brought to Shanghai by his uncle to work for the powerful gang ruled by Tang. He finds himself working for Bijou, Tang’s capricious mistress and nightclub singer. When Shuisheng’s uncle and several other gang members are killed during a rival gang’s unsuccessful attempt on Tang’s life, the latter escapes to a remote island taking both Bijou and Shuisheng with him and thinking of revenge. In Mandarin with English subtitles. Cast includes: Gong Li, Li Baotian, Li Xuejian, Sun Chun and Wang Xiaoxiao.

results.title: Shakespeare's theatre: The Globe Playhouse
results.creator_credit: Mildred Jordon, William Jordan and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Shows a model reconstruction of the Globe Playhouse, illustrating the separate stages, machinery, fixed scenery and acting conventions in brief extracts from Shakespeare’s plays as they were probably first performed. Incldues excerpts from Julius Caesar, Hamlet, Macbeth, Twelfth Night and Romeo and Juliet.

results.title: Shaft in Africa
results.creator_credit: John Guillermin, Roger Lewis, Shaft Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Super-slick detective John Shaft (Richard Roundtree) is back in this violent and action-packed follow up to “Shaft” (1971) and “Shaft’s Big Score” (1972). This time, Shaft is persuaded by African diplomats at the United Nations to hunt down and expose the operator of a sinister slave-trading racket. After receiving lessons in African customs from the diplomat’s beautiful daughter, Aleme (Vonetta McGee), Shaft goes to Africa and, posing as a native, allows himself to be captured. Things appear to be going smoothly until a traitor in the organisation reveals Shaft’s true identity. Forced to fend off attacks on his life using only traditional fighting methods, Shaft is caught in a race against time to bring the ruthless, murderous traders to justice. ‘Shaft in Africa’ is a bold, fast-paced film featuring memorable dialogue, saucy images, and a funky soundtrack. Richard Roundtree won an MTV Movie Award for lifetime achievement in 1994 for his roles in the Shaft films.

results.title: Shanghai noon
results.creator_credit: Tom Dey, Jonathan Glickman, Roger Birnbaum, Gary Barber, Touchstone Pictures, Spyglass Entertainment and Jackie Chan Films
results.brief_description: A case of East meets West in this comic adventure Jackie Chan film set in 1850s American West. Chon Wang (Jackie Chan), an Imperial Guard, is sent across to America as part of a rescue team to find the Emperor’s kidnapped daughter, Princess Pei Pei (Lucy Liu). However it is not long before Chon Wang becomes separated from the search party and finds himself lost out in the vast open spaces of the West where he has a timely encounter with a bright but arrogant train robber by the name of Roy O’Bannon (Owen Wilson). The two become unlikely allies. Cast also includes Brandon Merrill, Roger Yuan.

results.title: Shadows of the peacock = Echoes of paradise
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Jane Scott and Laughing Kookaburra Productions
results.brief_description: A married woman, and mother of three youngsters, is devastated by the infidelities of her philandering husband, which coincides with the death of her beloved father. With the view to reassess her life, she absconds to Thailand where she falls for a beautiful Balinese dancer. Despite her enjoyment of sexual fulfilment, freedom to explore her desire, and space for reflection away from her conventional suburban life, Maria is conflicted about her maternal duties and obligations. This interesting, early work by Phillip Noyce, intelligently probes the themes of female independence, motherhood and female sexuality within the context of ‘the other’ in this case being Maria’s lover. Maria questions her attraction in light of his exoticism and culture, which contrasts sharply to her rigid upbringing. Stars a young Claudia Karvan as Maria’s daughter. Also known as “Echoes of paradise”.

results.title: Shadows of our forgotten ancestors = Wild Horses of Fire
results.brief_description: Shadows of our forgotten ancestors was the film with which the Armenian Sergo Paradjanov first came to fame in the West. The story, drawn from Carpathian folklore, and set amongst the Huzul people, is a fairly conventional tale of blighted love, but what really distinguishes the film is its flamboyant visual style, its florid romanticism and its delirious pantheism - none of which endeared it to the Soviet authorities. The story begins with a blodd feud between two village clans, the wealthy Gutenyuks and the poor Pallicuks, and ends with a fight to death between two men. The film is a jungian parable: the ‘pure’ shepherd Ivan (Ivan Mikolaichuk) quest for reunion with is own ‘anima’, as represented by true love Marichka (Larissa Kadochnikova). Adpated from novel by Mikhail Kotzubinsky. In Ukrainian with English sub-titles. See also: Paradjanov’s “Caucasus Trilogy”: The Colour of Pomegranates & The Legend of the Suram Fortress. Ashik Kerib.

results.title: Shane
results.brief_description: George Stevens’ legendary rendition of the archetypal Western myth earned six Academy Award nominations and made “Shane” one of the timeless classics of American cinema. Based on on the novel by Jack Schaefer, a drifter and retired gunfighter (Alan Ladd) comes to the assistance of a homestead family terrorized by an aging cattleman and his hired gun. In fighting the last, decisive battle, Shane sees the end of his way of life. The mysterious, moody and breathtakingly atmospheric cinematography by Loyal Griggs won an Oscar and the film is enhanced by the intense performances of its splendid cast particularly Brandon de Wilde as the young son who idolises Shane.
